intro: Lepidium medium, commonly known as peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. Peppergrass is an annual plant that produces small, edible seeds, though it is not widely cultivated for human consumption.
